result.execSummary:
The defendant Honour M. Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay the court costs from the bail that's been posted.  Pay costs of supervision directly to DOC.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations for treatment.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment ordered by the agent.

Submit to a psychological evaluation and follow through with all recommendations.

No entry into bars, taverns, or places that primarily sell alcohol.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.  Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand of law enforcement officer or agent to monitor compliance.   

Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Honour M. Larsen
Current: 354 W Richland St, Lone Rock, WI 53556 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2017)
Prior: 26980 State Hwy 130, Hillpoint, WI 53937
RCSD Disposition of Warrant or Commitment - Time Served

15CF60, 15CF61, 15CF65, and 15CF75 called together for status.  Defendant Honour M. Larsen in court, in custody, with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. S states that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution in these matters.  Agreement detailed for the record; includes amendment of count 1 in 15CF65 to OWI 4th offense in 5 years, count 1 in 15CF60 to mis. battery as a dom. abuse incident, and count 1 of 15CF75 to misd. bail jumping.

15CF60 - Def pleads no contest to count 1 as amended to mis. battery as d.a. incident and count 2 as charged as disorderly conduct.
15CF61 - Def pleads no contact to count 1/OWI 3rd.
15CF65 - Def pleads no contest to count 1 as amended/OWI 4th offense within 5 years.
15CF75 - Def pleads no contest to count 1/misd. bail jumping.

Court's colloquy on pleas.  Counsel address the Court.  Defense asks for transfer of jail to Sauk County with release privileges and, if permitted, electronic monitoring.

Sentence:

15CF60 - probation for 2 years on withheld sentence.

15CF61 - per guidelines - 45 days jail, $1694 (or whatever $600 base plus costs comes out to), 24 mo rev, 24 mo IID upon relicensing, submit AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.  

15CF65 - probation of 3 years with conditions of 6 mo jail with good time, $600 plus costs, 2 years revocation (concurrent with 15CF61), 2 years IID upon relicensing (concurrent with that in 15CF61).  AODA/follow through, treatment.  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment ordered by agent.  Have psych. eval and follow through.  No alcohol poss. or consumption.  No bars/taverns or places that primarily sell alcohol.  Submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand of leo or agent to monitor compliance.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.  Court okay with electronic monitoring; defer to sheriff re eligibility determination.  Submit DNA sample.  Good time on the conditional jail.

15CF75 - 32 day sentence = time served.

Costs/fines to be removed from bail on all.  $66 on blood draw costs for RCPD in both OWI matters.

Huber granted on jail time.

All remaining counts dismissed/dismissed/read-in per the recommendation of counsel.

(Clerk notes that there was no order on whether jail in 15CF61 and 15CF65 is concurrent or consecutive.  As such, jail to run concurrent with each other in those two cases.)

15CF75/adjourned initial, 15CF60/status, 15CF65/status, and 15CF61/status.  Defendant Honour M. Larsen in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Saperstein informs the Court that these matters are not resolved; def wishes to waive her right to prelim.  Prelim waived.  Colloquy conducted.  Arraignment requested and set for 10/16 at 2:30.  Arraignment scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Honour M. Larsen in court with attorney David E Saperstein. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF65/initial (just filed this morning; defense has not yet seen the complaint), 15CF60/adjourned initial, and 15CF61/adjourned initial.  This is Atty. Saperstein's first appearance since retainer.  Atty. Saperstein states he and def have gone over the complaints in 15CF60 and 61; formal reading waived in those matters.  Atty. Saperstein asks that all of these matters be set for "status" to allow defense opportunity to review these matters and to allow defense opportunity to speak with prosecution.  Prelim time limits waived in all three cases.  9/30 at 1:30 for status.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Honour M. Larsen in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def states she is working at retaining counsel. Court will reset to another date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
